member.name: P:ModelContextProtocol.Client.IMcpClient.ServerInfo
member.summary: Gets the implementation information of the connected server.

remarks.para: This property provides identification details about the connected server, including its name and version. It is populated during the initialization handshake and is available after a successful connection.
This information can be useful for logging, debugging, compatibility checks, and displaying server information to users.

member.name: P:ModelContextProtocol.Client.IMcpClient.ServerInstructions
member.summary: Gets any instructions describing how to use the connected server and its features.

remarks.para: This property contains instructions provided by the server during initialization that explain how to effectively use its capabilities. These instructions can include details about available tools, expected input formats, limitations, or any other helpful information.
This can be used by clients to improve an LLM's understanding of available tools, prompts, and resources. It can be thought of like a "hint" to the model and may be added to a system prompt.

member.name: M:ModelContextProtocol.Client.McpClientExtensions.PingAsync(ModelContextProtocol.Client.IMcpClient,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Sends a ping request to verify server connectivity.
member.param: The client instance used to communicate with the MCP server.
The to monitor for cancellation requests. The default is .
member.returns: A task that completes when the ping is successful.

remarks.para: This method is used to check if the MCP server is online and responding to requests. It can be useful for health checking, ensuring the connection is established, or verifying that the client has proper authorization to communicate with the server.
The ping operation is lightweight and does not require any parameters. A successful completion of the task indicates that the server is operational and accessible.

member.exception: Thrown when the server cannot be reached or returns an error response.

member.name: M:ModelContextProtocol.Client.McpClientExtensions.ListToolsAsync(ModelContextProtocol.Client.IMcpClient,System.Text.Json.JsonSerializerOptions,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Retrieves a list of available tools from the server.
member.param: The client instance used to communicate with the MCP server.
The serializer options governing tool parameter serialization. If null, the default options will be used.
The to monitor for cancellation requests. The default is .
member.returns: A list of all available tools as instances.

remarks.para: This method fetches all available tools from the MCP server and returns them as a complete list. It automatically handles pagination with cursors if the server responds with only a portion per request.
For servers with a large number of tools and that responds with paginated responses, consider using instead, as it streams tools as they arrive rather than loading them all at once.
The serializer options provided are flowed to each and will be used when invoking tools in order to serialize any parameters.

member.name: M:ModelContextProtocol.Client.McpClientExtensions.EnumerateToolsAsync(ModelContextProtocol.Client.IMcpClient,System.Text.Json.JsonSerializerOptions,System.Threading.CancellationToken)

member.param: The client instance used to communicate with the MCP server.
The serializer options governing tool parameter serialization. If null, the default options will be used.
The to monitor for cancellation requests. The default is .
member.returns: An asynchronous sequence of all available tools as instances.

remarks.para: This method uses asynchronous enumeration to retrieve tools from the server, which allows processing tools as they arrive rather than waiting for all tools to be retrieved. The method automatically handles pagination with cursors if the server responds with tools split across multiple responses.
The serializer options provided are flowed to each and will be used when invoking tools in order to serialize any parameters.
Every iteration through the returned will result in re-querying the server and yielding the sequence of available tools.

member.name: M:ModelContextProtocol.Client.McpClientExtensions.UnsubscribeFromResourceAsync(ModelContextProtocol.Client.IMcpClient,System.String,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Unsubscribes from a resource on the server to stop receiving notifications about its changes.
member.param: The client instance used to communicate with the MCP server.
The URI of the resource to unsubscribe from.
The to monitor for cancellation requests. The default is .
member.returns: A task that represents the asynchronous operation.

remarks.para: This method cancels a previous subscription to a resource, stopping the client from receiving notifications when that resource changes.
The unsubscribe operation is idempotent, meaning it can be called multiple times for the same resource without causing errors, even if there is no active subscription.

Due to the nature of the MCP protocol, it is possible the client may receive notifications after unsubscribing if those notifications were issued by the server prior to the unsubscribe request being received.

member.name: P:ModelContextProtocol.Client.McpClientOptions.InitializationTimeout
member.summary: Gets or sets a timeout for the client-server initialization handshake sequence.

remarks.para: This timeout determines how long the client will wait for the server to respond during the initialization protocol handshake. If the server doesn't respond within this timeframe, an exception will be thrown.
Setting an appropriate timeout prevents the client from hanging indefinitely when connecting to unresponsive servers.
The default value is 60 seconds.

You need to tailor the tool's description for specific model requirements

member.name: T:ModelContextProtocol.IMcpEndpoint
member.summary: Represents a client or server Model Context Protocol (MCP) endpoint.

remarks.para:
The MCP endpoint provides the core communication functionality used by both clients and servers:
Sending JSON-RPC requests and receiving responses.
Sending notifications to the connected endpoint.
Registering handlers for receiving notifications.

serves as the base interface for both and interfaces, providing the common functionality needed for MCP protocol communication. Most applications will use these more specific interfaces rather than working with directly.
All MCP endpoints should be properly disposed after use as they implement .

member.remarks: This exception is used to represent failures to do with protocol-level concerns, such as invalid JSON-RPC requests, invalid parameters, or internal errors. It is not intended to be used for application-level errors. or from a may be propagated to the remote endpoint; sensitive information should not be included. If sensitive details need to be included, a different exception type should be used.

-32700: Parse error - Invalid JSON received
-32600: Invalid request - The JSON is not a valid Request object
-32601: Method not found - The method does not exist or is not available
-32602: Invalid params - Invalid method parameters
-32603: Internal error - Internal JSON-RPC error

member.name: T:ModelContextProtocol.Protocol.Messages.JsonRpcError
member.summary: Represents an error response message in the JSON-RPC protocol.

remarks.para: Error responses are sent when a request cannot be fulfilled or encounters an error during processing. Like successful responses, error messages include the same ID as the original request, allowing the sender to match errors with their corresponding requests.
Each error response contains a structured error detail object with a numeric code, descriptive message, and optional additional data to provide more context about the error.

member.name: P:ModelContextProtocol.Protocol.Messages.JsonRpcError.Error
member.summary: Gets detailed error information for the failed request, containing an error code, message, and optional additional data

member.name: T:ModelContextProtocol.Protocol.Messages.JsonRpcErrorDetail
member.summary: Represents detailed error information for JSON-RPC error responses.
member.remarks: This class is used as part of the message to provide structured error information when a request cannot be fulfilled. The JSON-RPC 2.0 specification defines a standard format for error responses that includes a numeric code, a human-readable message, and optional additional data.

member.name: P:ModelContextProtocol.Protocol.Messages.JsonRpcErrorDetail.Code
member.summary: Gets an integer error code according to the JSON-RPC specification.

member.name: P:ModelContextProtocol.Protocol.Messages.JsonRpcErrorDetail.Message
member.summary: Gets a short description of the error.
member.remarks: This is expected to be a brief, human-readable explanation of what went wrong. For standard error codes, it's recommended to use the descriptions defined in the JSON-RPC 2.0 specification.

member.name: P:ModelContextProtocol.Protocol.Messages.JsonRpcErrorDetail.Data
member.summary: Gets optional additional error data.
member.remarks: This property can contain any additional information that might help the client understand or resolve the error. Common examples include validation errors, stack traces (in development environments), or contextual information about the error condition.

member.name: T:ModelContextProtocol.Protocol.Messages.JsonRpcMessage
member.summary: Represents any JSON-RPC message used in the Model Context Protocol (MCP).
member.remarks: This interface serves as the foundation for all message types in the JSON-RPC 2.0 protocol used by MCP, including requests, responses, notifications, and errors. JSON-RPC is a stateless, lightweight remote procedure call (RPC) protocol that uses JSON as its data format.

member.name: P:ModelContextProtocol.Protocol.Messages.JsonRpcMessage.JsonRpc
member.summary: Gets the JSON-RPC protocol version used.

member.name: P:ModelContextProtocol.Protocol.Messages.JsonRpcMessage.RelatedTransport
member.summary: Gets or sets the transport the was received on or should be sent over.
member.remarks: This is used to support the Streamable HTTP transport where the specification states that the server SHOULD include JSON-RPC responses in the HTTP response body for the POST request containing the corresponding JSON-RPC request. It may be for other transports.

member.name: T:ModelContextProtocol.Protocol.Messages.JsonRpcMessageWithId
member.summary: Represents a JSON-RPC message used in the Model Context Protocol (MCP) and that includes an ID.
member.remarks: In the JSON-RPC protocol, messages with an ID require a response from the receiver. This includes request messages (which expect a matching response) and response messages (which include the ID of the original request they're responding to). The ID is used to correlate requests with their responses, allowing asynchronous communication where multiple requests can be sent without waiting for responses.

member.name: P:ModelContextProtocol.Protocol.Messages.JsonRpcMessageWithId.Id
member.summary: Gets the message identifier.
member.remarks: Each ID is expected to be unique within the context of a given session.

member.name: T:ModelContextProtocol.Protocol.Messages.JsonRpcNotification
member.summary: Represents a notification message in the JSON-RPC protocol.
member.remarks: Notifications are messages that do not require a response and are not matched with a response message. They are useful for one-way communication, such as log notifications and progress updates. Unlike requests, notifications do not include an ID field, since there will be no response to match with it.

member.name: P:ModelContextProtocol.Protocol.Messages.JsonRpcNotification.Method
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of the notification method.

member.name: P:ModelContextProtocol.Protocol.Messages.JsonRpcNotification.Params
member.summary: Gets or sets optional parameters for the notification.

member.name: T:ModelContextProtocol.Protocol.Messages.JsonRpcRequest
member.summary: A request message in the JSON-RPC protocol.
member.remarks:
Requests are messages that require a response from the receiver. Each request includes a unique ID that will be included in the corresponding response message (either a success response or an error).
The receiver of a request message is expected to execute the specified method with the provided parameters and return either a with the result, or a if the method execution fails.

member.name: P:ModelContextProtocol.Protocol.Messages.JsonRpcRequest.Method
member.summary: Name of the method to invoke.

member.name: P:ModelContextProtocol.Protocol.Messages.JsonRpcRequest.Params
member.summary: Optional parameters for the method.

member.summary: A successful response message in the JSON-RPC protocol.

remarks.para: Response messages are sent in reply to a request message and contain the result of the method execution. Each response includes the same ID as the original request, allowing the sender to match responses with their corresponding requests.
This class represents a successful response with a result. For error responses, see .

member.name: P:ModelContextProtocol.Protocol.Messages.JsonRpcResponse.Result
member.summary: Gets the result of the method invocation.
member.remarks: This property contains the result data returned by the server in response to the JSON-RPC method request.

member.name: T:ModelContextProtocol.Protocol.Messages.NotificationMethods
member.summary: Provides constants with the names of common notification methods used in the MCP protocol.

member.name: F:ModelContextProtocol.Protocol.Messages.NotificationMethods.ToolListChangedNotification
member.summary: The name of notification sent by a server when the list of available tools changes.
member.remarks: This notification informs clients that the set of available tools has been modified. Changes may include tools being added, removed, or updated. Upon receiving this notification, clients may refresh their tool list by calling the appropriate method to get the updated list of tools.

member.name: F:ModelContextProtocol.Protocol.Messages.NotificationMethods.PromptListChangedNotification
member.summary: The name of the notification sent by the server when the list of available prompts changes.
member.remarks: This notification informs clients that the set of available prompts has been modified. Changes may include prompts being added, removed, or updated. Upon receiving this notification, clients may refresh their prompt list by calling the appropriate method to get the updated list of prompts.

member.name: F:ModelContextProtocol.Protocol.Messages.NotificationMethods.ResourceListChangedNotification
member.summary: The name of the notification sent by the server when the list of available resources changes.
member.remarks: This notification informs clients that the set of available resources has been modified. Changes may include resources being added, removed, or updated. Upon receiving this notification, clients may refresh their resource list by calling the appropriate method to get the updated list of resources.

member.name: F:ModelContextProtocol.Protocol.Messages.NotificationMethods.ResourceUpdatedNotification
member.summary: The name of the notification sent by the server when a resource is updated.
member.remarks: This notification is used to inform clients about changes to a specific resource they have subscribed to. When a resource is updated, the server sends this notification to all clients that have subscribed to that resource.

member.name: F:ModelContextProtocol.Protocol.Messages.NotificationMethods.RootsUpdatedNotification
member.summary: The name of the notification sent by the client when roots have been updated.

remarks.para: This notification informs the server that the client's "roots" have changed. Roots define the boundaries of where servers can operate within the filesystem, allowing them to understand which directories and files they have access to. Servers can request the list of roots from supporting clients and receive notifications when that list changes.
After receiving this notification, servers may refresh their knowledge of roots by calling the appropriate method to get the updated list of roots from the client.

member.name: F:ModelContextProtocol.Protocol.Messages.NotificationMethods.LoggingMessageNotification
member.summary: The name of the notification sent by the server when a log message is generated.

remarks.para: This notification is used by the server to send log messages to clients. Log messages can include different severity levels, such as debug, info, warning, or error, and an optional logger name to identify the source component.

The minimum logging level that triggers notifications can be controlled by clients using the request. If no level has been set by a client, the server may determine which messages to send based on its own configuration.

member.name: F:ModelContextProtocol.Protocol.Messages.NotificationMethods.InitializedNotification
member.summary: The name of the notification sent from the client to the server after initialization has finished.

remarks.para: This notification is sent by the client after it has received and processed the server's response to the request. It signals that the client is ready to begin normal operation and that the initialization phase is complete.
After receiving this notification, the server can begin sending notifications and processing further requests from the client.

member.name: F:ModelContextProtocol.Protocol.Messages.NotificationMethods.ProgressNotification
member.summary: The name of the notification sent to inform the receiver of a progress update for a long-running request.

remarks.para: This notification provides updates on the progress of long-running operations. It includes a progress token that associates the notification with a specific request, the current progress value, and optionally, a total value and a descriptive message.

Progress notifications may be sent by either the client or the server, depending on the context. Progress notifications enable clients to display progress indicators for operations that might take significant time to complete, such as large file uploads, complex computations, or resource-intensive processing tasks.

member.name: F:ModelContextProtocol.Protocol.Messages.NotificationMethods.CancelledNotification
member.summary: The name of the notification sent to indicate that a previously-issued request should be canceled.

remarks.para: From the issuer's perspective, the request should still be in-flight. However, due to communication latency, it is always possible that this notification may arrive after the request has already finished.
This notification indicates that the result will be unused, so any associated processing SHOULD cease.
A client must not attempt to cancel its `initialize` request.

member.name: T:ModelContextProtocol.Protocol.Messages.PaginatedResult
member.summary: Provides a base class for result payloads that support cursor-based pagination.

remarks.para: Pagination allows API responses to be broken into smaller, manageable chunks when there are potentially many results to return or when dynamically-computed results may incur measurable latency.
Classes that inherit from implement cursor-based pagination, where the property serves as an opaque token pointing to the next set of results.

member.name: P:ModelContextProtocol.Protocol.Messages.PaginatedResult.NextCursor
member.summary: Gets or sets an opaque token representing the pagination position after the last returned result.
member.remarks: When a paginated result has more data available, the property will contain a non- token that can be used in subsequent requests to fetch the next page. When there are no more results to return, the property will be .

member.name: T:ModelContextProtocol.Protocol.Messages.ProgressNotification
member.summary: Represents an out-of-band notification used to inform the receiver of a progress update for a long-running request.
member.remarks: See the schema for more details.

member.name: P:ModelContextProtocol.Protocol.Messages.ProgressNotification.ProgressToken
member.summary: Gets or sets the progress token which was given in the initial request, used to associate this notification with the corresponding request.

member.name: F:ModelContextProtocol.Protocol.Messages.RequestMethods.LoggingSetLevel
member.summary: The name of the request method sent from the client to the server to adjust the logging level.
member.remarks: This request allows clients to control which log messages they receive from the server by setting a minimum severity threshold. After processing this request, the server will send log messages with severity at or above the specified level to the client as notifications.

member.name: F:ModelContextProtocol.Protocol.Messages.RequestMethods.CompletionComplete
member.summary: The name of the request method sent from the client to the server to ask for completion suggestions.
member.remarks: This is used to provide autocompletion-like functionality for arguments in a resource reference or a prompt template. The client provides a reference (resource or prompt), argument name, and partial value, and the server responds with matching completion options.

member.name: F:ModelContextProtocol.Protocol.Messages.RequestMethods.SamplingCreateMessage
member.summary: The name of the request method sent from the server to sample an large language model (LLM) via the client.
member.remarks: This request allows servers to utilize an LLM available on the client side to generate text or image responses based on provided messages. It is part of the sampling capability in the Model Context Protocol and enables servers to access client-side AI models without needing direct API access to those models.

member.name: F:ModelContextProtocol.Protocol.Messages.RequestMethods.Initialize
member.summary: The name of the request method sent from the client to the server when it first connects, asking it initialize.
member.remarks: The initialize request is the first request sent by the client to the server. It provides client information and capabilities to the server during connection establishment. The server responds with its own capabilities and information, establishing the protocol version and available features for the session.

member.name: T:ModelContextProtocol.Protocol.Transport.IClientTransport
member.summary: Represents a transport mechanism for Model Context Protocol (MCP) client-to-server communication.

remarks.para: The interface abstracts the communication layer between MCP clients and servers, allowing different transport protocols to be used interchangeably.
When creating an , is typically used, and is provided with the based on expected server configuration.

member.name: M:ModelContextProtocol.Protocol.Transport.IClientTransport.ConnectAsync(System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Asynchronously establishes a transport session with an MCP server and returns a transport for the duplex message stream.
member.param: The to monitor for cancellation requests. The default is .
member.returns: Returns an interface for the duplex message stream.

remarks.para: This method is responsible for initializing the connection to the server using the specific transport mechanism implemented by the derived class. The returned interface provides methods to send and receive messages over the established connection.
The lifetime of the returned instance is typically managed by the that uses this transport. When the client is disposed, it will dispose the transport session as well.
This method is used by to initialize the connection.

member.exception: The transport connection could not be established.

member.name: T:ModelContextProtocol.Protocol.Transport.ITransport
member.summary: Represents a transport mechanism for MCP (Model Context Protocol) communication between clients and servers.

remarks.para: The interface is the core abstraction for bidirectional communication. It provides methods for sending and receiving messages, abstracting away the underlying transport mechanism and allowing protocol implementations to be decoupled from communication details.
Implementations of handle the serialization, transmission, and reception of messages over various channels like standard input/output streams and HTTP (Server-Sent Events).
While is responsible for establishing a client's connection, represents an established session. Client implementations typically obtain an instance by calling .

member.name: P:ModelContextProtocol.Protocol.Transport.ITransport.MessageReader
member.summary: Gets a channel reader for receiving messages from the transport.

remarks.para: The provides access to incoming JSON-RPC messages received by the transport. It returns a which allows consuming messages in a thread-safe manner.

The reader will continue to provide messages as long as the transport is connected. When the transport is disconnected or disposed, the channel will be completed and no more messages will be available after any already transmitted messages are consumed.

member.summary: Sends a JSON-RPC message through the transport.

The to monitor for cancellation requests. The default is .
member.returns: A task that represents the asynchronous send operation.

remarks.para: This method serializes and sends the provided JSON-RPC message through the transport connection.

This is a core method used by higher-level abstractions in the MCP protocol implementation. Most client code should use the higher-level methods provided by , , , or , rather than accessing this method directly.

member.name: T:ModelContextProtocol.Protocol.Transport.SseResponseStreamTransport
member.summary: Provides an implementation using Server-Sent Events (SSE) for server-to-client communication.

remarks.para: This transport provides one-way communication from server to client using the SSE protocol over HTTP, while receiving client messages through a separate mechanism. It writes messages as SSE events to a response stream, typically associated with an HTTP response.

This transport is used in scenarios where the server needs to push messages to the client in real-time, such as when streaming completion results or providing progress updates during long-running operations.

member.param: The response stream to write MCP JSON-RPC messages as SSE events to.
The relative or absolute URI the client should use to post MCP JSON-RPC messages for this session. These messages should be passed to . Defaults to "/message".

member.name: M:ModelContextProtocol.Protocol.Transport.SseResponseStreamTransport.OnMessageReceivedAsync(ModelContextProtocol.Protocol.Messages.JsonRpcMessage,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Handles incoming JSON-RPC messages received on the /message endpoint.
member.param: The JSON-RPC message received from the client.
The to monitor for cancellation requests. The default is .
member.returns: A task representing the asynchronous operation to buffer the JSON-RPC message for processing.
member.exception: Thrown when there is an attempt to process a message before calling .

remarks.para: This method is the entry point for processing client-to-server communication in the SSE transport model. While the SSE protocol itself is unidirectional (server to client), this method allows bidirectional communication by handling HTTP POST requests sent to the message endpoint.
When a client sends a JSON-RPC message to the /message endpoint, the server calls this method to process the message and make it available to the MCP server via the channel.
This method validates that the transport is connected before processing the message, ensuring proper sequencing of operations in the transport lifecycle.

member.name: M:ModelContextProtocol.Protocol.Transport.StdioClientSessionTransport.SendMessageAsync(ModelContextProtocol.Protocol.Messages.JsonRpcMessage,System.Threading.CancellationToken)

remarks.para: For stdio-based transports, this implementation first verifies that the underlying process is still running before attempting to send the message. If the process has exited or cannot be accessed, a is thrown with details about the failure.
After verifying the process state, this method delegates to the base class implementation to handle the actual message serialization and transmission to the process's standard input stream.

member.exception: Thrown when the underlying process has exited or cannot be accessed.

member.name: T:ModelContextProtocol.Protocol.Transport.StdioClientTransport
member.summary: Provides a implemented via "stdio" (standard input/output).

remarks.para: This transport launches an external process and communicates with it through standard input and output streams. It's used to connect to MCP servers launched and hosted in child processes.

The transport manages the entire lifecycle of the process: starting it with specified command-line arguments and environment variables, handling output, and properly terminating the process when the transport is closed.

member.summary: Gets or sets the timeout to wait for the server to shut down gracefully.

The default is five seconds.

member.name: P:ModelContextProtocol.Protocol.Types.CallToolResponse.IsError
member.summary: Gets or sets an indication of whether the tool call was unsuccessful.
member.remarks: When set to , it signifies that the tool execution failed. Tool errors are reported with this property set to and details in the property, rather than as protocol-level errors. This allows LLMs to see that an error occurred and potentially self-correct in subsequent requests.

member.name: T:ModelContextProtocol.Protocol.Types.ClientCapabilities
member.summary: Represents the capabilities that a client may support.

remarks.para: Capabilities define the features and functionality that a client can handle when communicating with an MCP server. These are advertised to the server during the initialize handshake.
See the schema for details.

member.name: P:ModelContextProtocol.Protocol.Types.ClientCapabilities.Experimental
member.summary: Gets or sets experimental, non-standard capabilities that the client supports.

remarks.para: The dictionary allows clients to advertise support for features that are not yet standardized in the Model Context Protocol specification. This extension mechanism enables future protocol enhancements while maintaining backward compatibility.

Values in this dictionary are implementation-specific and should be coordinated between client and server implementations. Servers should not assume the presence of any experimental capability without checking for it first.

member.name: P:ModelContextProtocol.Protocol.Types.ClientCapabilities.Roots
member.summary: Gets or sets the client's roots capability, which are entry points for resource navigation.

remarks.para: When is non-, the client indicates that it can respond to server requests for listing root URIs. Root URIs serve as entry points for resource navigation in the protocol.
The server can use to request the list of available roots from the client, which will trigger the client's .

member.name: P:ModelContextProtocol.Protocol.Types.ClientCapabilities.Sampling
member.summary: Gets or sets the client's sampling capability, which indicates whether the client supports issuing requests to an LLM on behalf of the server.

member.name: P:ModelContextProtocol.Protocol.Types.ClientCapabilities.NotificationHandlers
member.summary: Gets or sets notification handlers to register with the client.

remarks.para: When constructed, the client will enumerate these handlers once, which may contain multiple handlers per notification method key. The client will not re-enumerate the sequence after initialization.

Notification handlers allow the client to respond to server-sent notifications for specific methods. Each key in the collection is a notification method name, and each value is a callback that will be invoked when a notification with that method is received.

Handlers provided via will be registered with the client for the lifetime of the client. For transient handlers, may be used to register a handler that can then be unregistered by disposing of the returned from the method.

member.name: T:ModelContextProtocol.Protocol.Types.CompleteRequestParams
member.summary: Represents the parameters used with a request from a client to ask a server for auto-completion suggestions.

remarks.para: is used in the Model Context Protocol completion workflow to provide intelligent suggestions for partial inputs related to resources, prompts, or other referenceable entities. The completion mechanism in MCP allows clients to request suggestions based on partial inputs. The server will respond with a containing matching values.
See the schema for details.

member.name: P:ModelContextProtocol.Protocol.Types.CompleteRequestParams.Ref
member.summary: Gets or sets the reference's information.

member.name: P:ModelContextProtocol.Protocol.Types.CompleteRequestParams.Argument
member.summary: Gets or sets the argument information for the completion request, specifying what is being completed and the current partial input.

member.name: T:ModelContextProtocol.Protocol.Types.CompleteResult
member.summary: Represents the server's response to a request, containing suggested values for a given argument.

remarks.para: is returned by the server in response to a request from the client. It provides suggested completions or valid values for a specific argument in a tool or resource reference.
The result contains a object with suggested values, pagination information, and the total number of available completions. This is similar to auto-completion functionality in code editors.
Clients typically use this to implement auto-suggestion features when users are inputting parameters for tool calls or resource references.
See the schema for details.

member.name: P:ModelContextProtocol.Protocol.Types.CompleteResult.Completion
member.summary: Gets or sets the completion object containing the suggested values and pagination information.
member.remarks: If no completions are available for the given input, the collection will be empty.

member.name: T:ModelContextProtocol.Protocol.Types.Completion
member.summary: Represents a completion object in the server's response to a request.
member.remarks: See the schema for details.

member.name: P:ModelContextProtocol.Protocol.Types.Completion.Values
member.summary: Gets or sets an array of completion values (auto-suggestions) for the requested input.
member.remarks: This collection contains the actual text strings to be presented to users as completion suggestions. The array will be empty if no suggestions are available for the current input. Per the specification, this should not exceed 100 items.

member.name: P:ModelContextProtocol.Protocol.Types.Completion.Total
member.summary: Gets or sets the total number of completion options available.
member.remarks: This can exceed the number of values actually sent in the response.

member.name: P:ModelContextProtocol.Protocol.Types.Completion.HasMore
member.summary: Gets or sets an indicator as to whether there are additional completion options beyond those provided in the current response, even if the exact total is unknown.

member.name: T:ModelContextProtocol.Protocol.Types.CompletionsCapability
member.summary: Represents the completions capability for providing auto-completion suggestions for prompt arguments and resource references.

remarks.para: When enabled, this capability allows a Model Context Protocol server to provide auto-completion suggestions. This capability is advertised to clients during the initialize handshake.
The primary function of this capability is to improve the user experience by offering contextual suggestions for argument values or resource identifiers based on partial input.
See the schema for details.

member.name: P:ModelContextProtocol.Protocol.Types.CompletionsCapability.CompleteHandler
member.summary: Gets or sets the handler for completion requests.
member.remarks: This handler provides auto-completion suggestions for prompt arguments or resource references in the Model Context Protocol. The handler receives a reference type (e.g., "ref/prompt" or "ref/resource") and the current argument value, and should return appropriate completion suggestions.

member.name: T:ModelContextProtocol.Protocol.Types.Content
member.summary: Represents content within the Model Context Protocol (MCP) that can contain text, binary data, or references to resources.

remarks.para: The class is a fundamental type in the MCP that can represent different forms of content based on the property. The main content types are:

item.description: "text" - Textual content, stored in the property
"image" - Image data, stored as base64 in the property with appropriate MIME type
"audio" - Audio data, stored as base64 in the property with appropriate MIME type
"resource" - Reference to a resource, accessed through the property

remarks.para: This class is used extensively throughout the MCP for representing content in messages, tool responses, and other communication between clients and servers.
See the schema for more details.

member.name: P:ModelContextProtocol.Protocol.Types.Content.Type
member.summary: Gets or sets the type of content.
member.remarks: This determines the structure of the content object. Valid values include "image", "audio", "text", and "resource".

member.name: P:ModelContextProtocol.Protocol.Types.Content.Text
member.summary: Gets or sets the text content of the message.

member.name: P:ModelContextProtocol.Protocol.Types.Content.Data
member.summary: Gets or sets the base64-encoded image or audio data.

member.name: P:ModelContextProtocol.Protocol.Types.Content.MimeType
member.summary: Gets or sets the MIME type (or "media type") of the content, specifying the format of the data.

remarks.para: This property is used when is "image", "audio", or "resource", to indicate the specific format of the binary data. Common values include "image/png", "image/jpeg", "audio/wav", and "audio/mp3".
This property is required when the property contains binary content, as it helps clients properly interpret and render the content.

member.name: P:ModelContextProtocol.Protocol.Types.Content.Resource
member.summary: Gets or sets the resource content of the message when is "resource".

remarks.para: This property is used to embed or reference resource data within a message. It's only applicable when the property is set to "resource".
Resources can be either text-based () or binary (), allowing for flexible data representation. Each resource has a URI that can be used for identification and retrieval.

member.name: P:ModelContextProtocol.Protocol.Types.Content.Annotations
member.summary: Gets or sets optional annotations for the content.
member.remarks: These annotations can be used to specify the intended audience (, , or both) and the priority level of the content. Clients can use this information to filter or prioritize content for different roles.

member.name: T:ModelContextProtocol.Protocol.Types.ContextInclusion
member.summary: Specifies the context inclusion options for a request in the Model Context Protocol (MCP).
member.remarks: See the schema for details.

member.name: F:ModelContextProtocol.Protocol.Types.ContextInclusion.None
member.summary: Indicates that no context should be included.

member.name: F:ModelContextProtocol.Protocol.Types.ContextInclusion.ThisServer
member.summary: Indicates that context from the server that sent the request should be included.

member.name: F:ModelContextProtocol.Protocol.Types.ContextInclusion.AllServers
member.summary: Indicates that context from all servers that the client is connected to should be included.

member.name: T:ModelContextProtocol.Protocol.Types.CreateMessageRequestParams
member.summary: Represents the parameters used with a request from a server to sample an LLM via the client.
member.remarks: See the schema for details.

member.name: P:ModelContextProtocol.Protocol.Types.CreateMessageRequestParams.IncludeContext
member.summary: Gets or sets an indication as to which server contexts should be included in the prompt.
member.remarks: The client may ignore this request.

member.name: P:ModelContextProtocol.Protocol.Types.CreateMessageRequestParams.MaxTokens
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum number of tokens to generate in the LLM response, as requested by the server.
member.remarks: A token is generally a word or part of a word in the text. Setting this value helps control response length and computation time. The client may choose to sample fewer tokens than requested.

member.name: P:ModelContextProtocol.Protocol.Types.CreateMessageRequestParams.Messages
member.summary: Gets or sets the messages requested by the server to be included in the prompt.

member.name: P:ModelContextProtocol.Protocol.Types.CreateMessageRequestParams.Metadata
member.summary: Gets or sets optional metadata to pass through to the LLM provider.
member.remarks: The format of this metadata is provider-specific and can include model-specific settings or configuration that isn't covered by standard parameters. This allows for passing custom parameters that are specific to certain AI models or providers.

member.name: P:ModelContextProtocol.Protocol.Types.CreateMessageRequestParams.ModelPreferences
member.summary: Gets or sets the server's preferences for which model to select.

remarks.para: The client may ignore these preferences.
These preferences help the client make an appropriate model selection based on the server's priorities for cost, speed, intelligence, and specific model hints.

When multiple dimensions are specified (cost, speed, intelligence), the client should balance these based on their relative values. If specific model hints are provided, the client should evaluate them in order and prioritize them over numeric priorities.

member.name: P:ModelContextProtocol.Protocol.Types.CreateMessageRequestParams.StopSequences
member.summary: Gets or sets optional sequences of characters that signal the LLM to stop generating text when encountered.

remarks.para: When the model generates any of these sequences during sampling, text generation stops immediately, even if the maximum token limit hasn't been reached. This is useful for controlling generation endings or preventing the model from continuing beyond certain points.

Stop sequences are typically case-sensitive, and typically the LLM will only stop generation when a produced sequence exactly matches one of the provided sequences. Common uses include ending markers like "END", punctuation like ".", or special delimiter sequences like "###".

member.name: P:ModelContextProtocol.Protocol.Types.CreateMessageRequestParams.SystemPrompt
member.summary: Gets or sets an optional system prompt the server wants to use for sampling.
member.remarks: The client may modify or omit this prompt.

member.name: P:ModelContextProtocol.Protocol.Types.CreateMessageRequestParams.Temperature
member.summary: Gets or sets the temperature to use for sampling, as requested by the server.

member.name: T:ModelContextProtocol.Protocol.Types.CreateMessageResult
member.summary: Represents a client's response to a from the server.
member.remarks: See the schema for details.

member.name: P:ModelContextProtocol.Protocol.Types.CreateMessageResult.Content
member.summary: Gets or sets the content of the message.

member.name: P:ModelContextProtocol.Protocol.Types.CreateMessageResult.Model
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of the model that generated the message.

remarks.para: This should contain the specific model identifier such as "claude-3-5-sonnet-20241022" or "o3-mini".
This property allows the server to know which model was used to generate the response, enabling appropriate handling based on the model's capabilities and characteristics.

member.name: P:ModelContextProtocol.Protocol.Types.CreateMessageResult.StopReason
member.summary: Gets or sets the reason why message generation (sampling) stopped, if known.
member.remarks:
Common values include:
endTurnThe model naturally completed its response.
maxTokensThe response was truncated due to reaching token limits.
stopSequenceA specific stop sequence was encountered during generation.

member.name: P:ModelContextProtocol.Protocol.Types.CreateMessageResult.Role
member.summary: Gets or sets the role of the user who generated the message.

member.name: T:ModelContextProtocol.Protocol.Types.EmptyResult
member.summary: Represents an empty result object for operations that need to indicate successful completion but don't need to return any specific data.

member.name: T:ModelContextProtocol.Protocol.Types.GetPromptRequestParams
member.summary: Represents the parameters used with a request from a client to get a prompt provided by a server.
member.remarks: The server will respond with a containing the resulting prompt. See the schema for details.

member.name: P:ModelContextProtocol.Protocol.Types.GetPromptRequestParams.Name
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of the prompt.

member.name: P:ModelContextProtocol.Protocol.Types.GetPromptRequestParams.Arguments
member.summary: Gets or sets arguments to use for templating the prompt when retrieving it from the server.
member.remarks: Typically, these arguments are used to replace placeholders in prompt templates. The keys in this dictionary should match the names defined in the prompt's list. However, the server may choose to use these arguments in any way it deems appropriate to generate the prompt.

member.name: T:ModelContextProtocol.Protocol.Types.GetPromptResult
member.summary: Represents a server's response to a request from the client.

remarks.para: For integration with AI client libraries, can be converted to a collection of objects using the extension method.
See the schema for details.

member.name: P:ModelContextProtocol.Protocol.Types.GetPromptResult.Description
member.summary: Gets or sets an optional description for the prompt.

remarks.para: This description provides contextual information about the prompt's purpose and use cases. It helps developers understand what the prompt is designed for and how it should be used.
When returned from a server in response to a request, this description can be used by client applications to provide context about the prompt or to display in user interfaces.

member.name: P:ModelContextProtocol.Protocol.Types.GetPromptResult.Messages
member.summary: Gets or sets the prompt that the server offers.

member.name: T:ModelContextProtocol.Protocol.Types.Implementation
member.summary: Provides the name and version of an MCP implementation.

remarks.para: The class is used to identify MCP clients and servers during the initialization handshake. It provides version and name information that can be used for compatibility checks, logging, and debugging.
Both clients and servers provide this information during connection establishment.
See the schema for details.

member.name: P:ModelContextProtocol.Protocol.Types.Implementation.Name
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of the implementation.
member.remarks: This is typically the name of the client or server library/application.

member.name: P:ModelContextProtocol.Protocol.Types.Implementation.Version
member.summary: Gets or sets the version of the implementation.
member.remarks: The version is used during client-server handshake to identify implementation versions, which can be important for troubleshooting compatibility issues or when reporting bugs.

member.name: T:ModelContextProtocol.Protocol.Types.InitializeRequestParams
member.summary: Represents the parameters used with a request sent by a client to a server during the protocol handshake.

remarks.para: The is the first message sent in the Model Context Protocol communication flow. It establishes the connection between client and server, negotiates the protocol version, and declares the client's capabilities.
After sending this request, the client should wait for an response before sending an notification to complete the handshake.
See the schema for details.

member.name: P:ModelContextProtocol.Protocol.Types.InitializeRequestParams.ProtocolVersion
member.summary: Gets or sets the version of the Model Context Protocol that the client wants to use.

remarks.para: Protocol version is specified using a date-based versioning scheme in the format "YYYY-MM-DD". The client and server must agree on a protocol version to communicate successfully.
During initialization, the server will check if it supports this requested version. If there's a mismatch, the server will reject the connection with a version mismatch error.
See the protocol specification for version details.

member.name: P:ModelContextProtocol.Protocol.Types.InitializeRequestParams.Capabilities
member.summary: Gets or sets the client's capabilities.
member.remarks: Capabilities define the features the client supports, such as "sampling" or "roots".

member.name: P:ModelContextProtocol.Protocol.Types.InitializeRequestParams.ClientInfo
member.summary: Gets or sets information about the client implementation, including its name and version.
member.remarks: This information is required during the initialization handshake to identify the client. Servers may use this information for logging, debugging, or compatibility checks.

member.name: T:ModelContextProtocol.Protocol.Types.InitializeResult
member.summary: Represents the result of a request sent to the server during connection establishment.

remarks.para: The is sent by the server in response to an message from the client. It contains information about the server, its capabilities, and the protocol version that will be used for the session.
After receiving this response, the client should send an notification to complete the handshake.
See the schema for details.

member.name: P:ModelContextProtocol.Protocol.Types.InitializeResult.ProtocolVersion
member.summary: Gets or sets the version of the Model Context Protocol that the server will use for this session.

remarks.para: This is the protocol version the server has agreed to use, which should match the client's requested version. If there's a mismatch, the client should throw an exception to prevent communication issues due to incompatible protocol versions.
The protocol uses a date-based versioning scheme in the format "YYYY-MM-DD".
See the protocol specification for version details.

member.name: P:ModelContextProtocol.Protocol.Types.InitializeResult.Capabilities
member.summary: Gets or sets the server's capabilities.
member.remarks: This defines the features the server supports, such as "tools", "prompts", "resources", or "logging", and other protocol-specific functionality.

member.name: P:ModelContextProtocol.Protocol.Types.InitializeResult.ServerInfo
member.summary: Gets or sets information about the server implementation, including its name and version.
member.remarks: This information identifies the server during the initialization handshake. Clients may use this information for logging, debugging, or compatibility checks.

member.name: P:ModelContextProtocol.Protocol.Types.InitializeResult.Instructions
member.summary: Gets or sets optional instructions for using the server and its features.

remarks.para: These instructions provide guidance to clients on how to effectively use the server's capabilities. They can include details about available tools, expected input formats, limitations, or any other information that helps clients interact with the server properly.
Client applications often use these instructions as system messages for LLM interactions to provide context about available functionality.

member.name: T:ModelContextProtocol.Protocol.Types.ListPromptsRequestParams
member.summary: Represents the parameters used with a request from a client to request a list of prompts available from the server.
member.remarks: The server responds with a containing the available prompts. See the schema for details.

member.name: T:ModelContextProtocol.Protocol.Types.ListPromptsResult
member.summary: Represents a server's response to a request from the client, containing available prompts.

remarks.para: This result is returned when a client sends a request to discover available prompts on the server.

It inherits from , allowing for paginated responses when there are many prompts. The server can provide the property to indicate there are more prompts available beyond what was returned in the current response.
See the schema for details.

member.name: P:ModelContextProtocol.Protocol.Types.ListPromptsResult.Prompts
member.summary: A list of prompts or prompt templates that the server offers.

member.name: T:ModelContextProtocol.Protocol.Types.ListResourcesRequestParams
member.summary: Represents the parameters used with a request from a client to request a list of resources available from the server.
member.remarks: The server responds with a containing the available resources. See the schema for details.

member.name: T:ModelContextProtocol.Protocol.Types.ListResourcesResult
member.summary: Represents a server's response to a request from the client, containing available resources.

remarks.para: This result is returned when a client sends a request to discover available resources on the server.

It inherits from , allowing for paginated responses when there are many resources. The server can provide the property to indicate there are more resources available beyond what was returned in the current response.
See the schema for details.

member.name: P:ModelContextProtocol.Protocol.Types.ListResourcesResult.Resources
member.summary: A list of resources that the server offers.

member.name: T:ModelContextProtocol.Protocol.Types.ListResourceTemplatesRequestParams
member.summary: Represents the parameters used with a request from a client to request a list of resource templates available from the server.
member.remarks: The server responds with a containing the available resource templates. See the schema for details.

member.name: T:ModelContextProtocol.Protocol.Types.ListResourceTemplatesResult
member.summary: Represents a server's response to a request from the client, containing available resource templates.

remarks.para: This result is returned when a client sends a request to discover available resource templates on the server.

It inherits from , allowing for paginated responses when there are many resource templates. The server can provide the property to indicate there are more resource templates available beyond what was returned in the current response.
See the schema for details.

member.name: P:ModelContextProtocol.Protocol.Types.ListResourceTemplatesResult.ResourceTemplates
member.summary: Gets or sets a list of resource templates that the server offers.
member.remarks: This collection contains all the resource templates returned in the current page of results. Each provides metadata about resources available on the server, including URI templates, names, descriptions, and MIME types.

member.name: T:ModelContextProtocol.Protocol.Types.ListRootsRequestParams
member.summary: Represents the parameters used with a request from a server to request a list of roots available from the client.
member.remarks: The client responds with a containing the client's roots. See the schema for details.

member.name: T:ModelContextProtocol.Protocol.Types.ListRootsResult
member.summary: Represents a client's response to a request from the server, containing available roots.

remarks.para: This result is returned when a server sends a request to discover available roots on the client.
See the schema for details.

member.name: P:ModelContextProtocol.Protocol.Types.ListRootsResult.Meta
member.summary: Gets or sets additional metadata for the result.
member.remarks: This property is reserved by the protocol for future use.

member.name: P:ModelContextProtocol.Protocol.Types.ListRootsResult.Roots
member.summary: Gets or sets the list of root URIs provided by the client.
member.remarks: This collection contains all available root URIs and their associated metadata. Each root serves as an entry point for resource navigation in the Model Context Protocol.

member.name: T:ModelContextProtocol.Protocol.Types.ListToolsRequestParams
member.summary: Represents the parameters used with a request from a client to request a list of tools available from the server.
member.remarks: The server responds with a containing the available tools. See the schema for details.

member.name: T:ModelContextProtocol.Protocol.Types.ListToolsResult
member.summary: Represents a server's response to a request from the client, containing available tools.

remarks.para: This result is returned when a client sends a request to discover available tools on the server.

It inherits from , allowing for paginated responses when there are many tools. The server can provide the property to indicate there are more tools available beyond what was returned in the current response.
See the schema for details.

member.name: P:ModelContextProtocol.Protocol.Types.ListToolsResult.Tools
member.summary: The server's response to a tools/list request from the client.

member.name: T:ModelContextProtocol.Protocol.Types.LoggingCapability
member.summary: Represents the logging capability configuration for a Model Context Protocol server.
member.remarks: This capability allows clients to set the logging level and receive log messages from the server. See the schema for details.

member.name: P:ModelContextProtocol.Protocol.Types.LoggingCapability.SetLoggingLevelHandler
member.summary: Gets or sets the handler for set logging level requests from clients.

member.name: T:ModelContextProtocol.Protocol.Types.LoggingLevel
member.summary: Indicates the severity of a log message.
member.remarks: These map to syslog message severities, as specified in RFC-5424.

member.name: F:ModelContextProtocol.Protocol.Types.LoggingLevel.Debug
member.summary: Detailed debug information, typically only valuable to developers.

member.name: F:ModelContextProtocol.Protocol.Types.LoggingLevel.Info
member.summary: Normal operational messages that require no action.

member.name: F:ModelContextProtocol.Protocol.Types.LoggingLevel.Notice
member.summary: Normal but significant events that might deserve attention.

member.name: F:ModelContextProtocol.Protocol.Types.LoggingLevel.Warning
member.summary: Warning conditions that don't represent an error but indicate potential issues.

member.name: F:ModelContextProtocol.Protocol.Types.LoggingLevel.Error
member.summary: Error conditions that should be addressed but don't require immediate action.

member.name: F:ModelContextProtocol.Protocol.Types.LoggingLevel.Critical
member.summary: Critical conditions that require immediate attention.

member.name: F:ModelContextProtocol.Protocol.Types.LoggingLevel.Alert
member.summary: Action must be taken immediately to address the condition.

member.name: F:ModelContextProtocol.Protocol.Types.LoggingLevel.Emergency
member.summary: System is unusable and requires immediate attention.

member.name: T:ModelContextProtocol.Protocol.Types.LoggingMessageNotificationParams
member.summary: Represents the parameters used with a notification sent whenever a log message is generated.

remarks.para: Logging notifications allow servers to communicate diagnostic information to clients with varying severity levels. Clients can filter these messages based on the and properties.
If no request has been sent from the client, the server may decide which messages to send automatically.
See the schema for details.

member.name: P:ModelContextProtocol.Protocol.Types.LoggingMessageNotificationParams.Level
member.summary: Gets or sets the severity of this log message.

member.name: P:ModelContextProtocol.Protocol.Types.LoggingMessageNotificationParams.Logger
member.summary: Gets or sets an optional name of the logger issuing this message.

remarks.para: typically represents a category or component in the server's logging system. The logger name is useful for filtering and routing log messages in client applications.
When implementing custom servers, choose clear, hierarchical logger names to help clients understand the source of log messages.

member.name: P:ModelContextProtocol.Protocol.Types.LoggingMessageNotificationParams.Data
member.summary: Gets or sets the data to be logged, such as a string message.

member.name: T:ModelContextProtocol.Protocol.Types.ModelHint
member.summary: Provides hints to use for model selection.

remarks.para: When multiple hints are specified in , they are evaluated in order, with the first match taking precedence. Clients should prioritize these hints over numeric priorities.
See the schema for details.

member.name: P:ModelContextProtocol.Protocol.Types.ModelHint.Name
member.summary: Gets or sets a hint for a model name.
member.remarks: The specified string can be a partial or full model name. Clients may also map hints to equivalent models from different providers. Clients make the final model selection based on these preferences and their available models.

member.name: T:ModelContextProtocol.Protocol.Types.ModelPreferences
member.summary: Represents a server's preferences for model selection, requested of the client during sampling.

remarks.para: Because LLMs can vary along multiple dimensions, choosing the "best" model is rarely straightforward. Different models excel in different areassome are faster but less capable, others are more capable but more expensive, and so on. This class allows servers to express their priorities across multiple dimensions to help clients make an appropriate selection for their use case.
These preferences are always advisory. The client may ignore them. It is also up to the client to decide how to interpret these preferences and how to balance them against other considerations.
See the schema for details.

member.name: P:ModelContextProtocol.Protocol.Types.ModelPreferences.CostPriority
member.summary: Gets or sets how much to prioritize cost when selecting a model.
member.remarks: A value of 0 means cost is not important, while a value of 1 means cost is the most important factor.

member.name: P:ModelContextProtocol.Protocol.Types.ModelPreferences.Hints
member.summary: Gets or sets optional hints to use for model selection.

member.name: P:ModelContextProtocol.Protocol.Types.ModelPreferences.SpeedPriority
member.summary: Gets or sets how much to prioritize sampling speed (latency) when selecting a model.
member.remarks: A value of 0 means speed is not important, while a value of 1 means speed is the most important factor.

member.name: P:ModelContextProtocol.Protocol.Types.ModelPreferences.IntelligencePriority
member.summary: Gets or sets how much to prioritize intelligence and capabilities when selecting a model.
member.remarks: A value of 0 means intelligence is not important, while a value of 1 means intelligence is the most important factor.

member.name: T:ModelContextProtocol.Protocol.Types.PaginatedRequestParams
member.summary: Provides a base class for paginated requests.

member.name: P:ModelContextProtocol.Protocol.Types.PaginatedRequestParams.Cursor
member.summary: Gets or sets an opaque token representing the current pagination position.
member.remarks: If provided, the server should return results starting after this cursor. This value should be obtained from the property of a previous request's response.

member.name: T:ModelContextProtocol.Protocol.Types.PingResult
member.summary: Represents the result of a request in the Model Context Protocol.

remarks.para: The is returned in response to a request, which is used to verify that the connection between client and server is still alive and responsive. Since this is a simple connectivity check, the result is an empty object containing no data.
Ping requests can be initiated by either the client or the server to check if the other party is still responsive.

member.name: T:ModelContextProtocol.Protocol.Types.Prompt
member.summary: Represents a prompt that the server offers.
member.remarks: See the schema for details.

member.name: P:ModelContextProtocol.Protocol.Types.Prompt.Arguments
member.summary: Gets or sets a list of arguments that this prompt accepts for templating and customization.

remarks.para: This list defines the arguments that can be provided when requesting the prompt. Each argument specifies metadata like name, description, and whether it's required.
When a client makes a request, it can provide values for these arguments which will be substituted into the prompt template or otherwise used to render the prompt.

member.name: P:ModelContextProtocol.Protocol.Types.Prompt.Description
member.summary: Gets or sets an optional description of what this prompt provides.

remarks.para: This description helps developers understand the purpose and use cases for the prompt. It should explain what the prompt is designed to accomplish and any important context.
The description is typically used in documentation, UI displays, and for providing context to client applications that may need to choose between multiple available prompts.

member.name: P:ModelContextProtocol.Protocol.Types.Prompt.Name
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of the prompt.

member.summary: Gets or sets an indication as to whether this argument must be provided when requesting the prompt.
member.remarks: When set to , the client must include this argument when making a request. If a required argument is missing, the server should respond with an error.

member.name: T:ModelContextProtocol.Protocol.Types.PromptMessage
member.summary: Represents a message within the Model Context Protocol (MCP) system, used for communication between clients and AI models.

remarks.para: A encapsulates content sent to or received from AI models in the Model Context Protocol. Each message has a specific role ( or ) and contains content which can be text, images, audio, or embedded resources.

This class is similar to , but with enhanced support for embedding resources from the MCP server. It serves as a core data structure in the MCP message exchange flow, particularly in prompt formation and model responses.
objects are typically used in collections within to represent complete conversations or prompt sequences. They can be converted to and from objects using the extension methods and .
See the schema for details.

member.name: P:ModelContextProtocol.Protocol.Types.PromptMessage.Content
member.summary: Gets or sets the content of the message, which can be text, image, audio, or an embedded resource.
member.remarks: The object contains all the message payload, whether it's simple text, base64-encoded binary data (for images/audio), or a reference to an embedded resource. The property indicates the specific content type.

member.name: P:ModelContextProtocol.Protocol.Types.PromptMessage.Role
member.summary: Gets or sets the role of the message sender, specifying whether it's from a "user" or an "assistant".
member.remarks: In the Model Context Protocol, each message must have a clear role assignment to maintain the conversation flow. User messages represent queries or inputs from users, while assistant messages represent responses generated by AI models.

member.name: T:ModelContextProtocol.Protocol.Types.PromptsCapability
member.summary: Represents the server's capability to provide predefined prompt templates that clients can use.

remarks.para: The prompts capability allows a server to expose a collection of predefined prompt templates that clients can discover and use. These prompts can be static (defined in the ) or dynamically generated through handlers.
See the schema for details.

member.name: P:ModelContextProtocol.Protocol.Types.PromptsCapability.ListChanged
member.summary: Gets or sets whether this server supports notifications for changes to the prompt list.
member.remarks: When set to , the server will send notifications using when prompts are added, removed, or modified. Clients can register handlers for these notifications to refresh their prompt cache. This capability enables clients to stay synchronized with server-side changes to available prompts.

member.name: P:ModelContextProtocol.Protocol.Types.PromptsCapability.ListPromptsHandler
member.summary: Gets or sets the handler for requests.
member.remarks: This handler is invoked when a client requests a list of available prompts from the server via a request. Results from this handler are returned along with any prompts defined in .

member.name: P:ModelContextProtocol.Protocol.Types.PromptsCapability.GetPromptHandler
member.summary: Gets or sets the handler for requests.

remarks.para: This handler will be invoked if the requested prompt name is not found in the , allowing for dynamic prompt generation or retrieval from external sources.

member.name: P:ModelContextProtocol.Protocol.Types.PromptsCapability.PromptCollection
member.summary: Gets or sets a collection of prompts that will be served by the server.

remarks.para: The contains the predefined prompts that clients can request from the server. This collection works in conjunction with and when those are provided:
- For requests: The server returns all prompts from this collection plus any additional prompts provided by the if it's set.
- For requests: The server first checks this collection for the requested prompt. If not found, it will invoke the as a fallback if one is set.

item.description: For resource references, set to "ref/resource" and provide the property.
For prompt references, set to "ref/prompt" and provide the property.

remarks.para: References are commonly used with to request completion suggestions for arguments, and with other methods that need to reference resources or prompts.

member.param: When this method returns false, contains a message explaining why validation failed; otherwise, null.
member.returns: True if the reference is valid; otherwise, false.

member.remarks: This class contains properties that are used by the Model Context Protocol for features like progress tracking and other protocol-specific capabilities.

member.summary: Gets or sets an opaque token that will be attached to any subsequent progress notifications.
member.remarks: The receiver is not obligated to provide these notifications.

member.name: T:ModelContextProtocol.Protocol.Types.Resource
member.summary: Represents a known resource that the server is capable of reading.
member.remarks: See the schema for details.

member.name: P:ModelContextProtocol.Protocol.Types.Resource.Uri
member.summary: Gets or sets the URI of this resource.

member.name: P:ModelContextProtocol.Protocol.Types.Resource.Name
member.summary: Gets or sets a human-readable name for this resource.

member.name: P:ModelContextProtocol.Protocol.Types.Resource.Description
member.summary: Gets or sets a description of what this resource represents.

remarks.para: This can be used by clients to improve the LLM's understanding of available resources. It can be thought of like a \"hint\" to the model.
The description should provide clear context about the resource's content, format, and purpose. This helps AI models make better decisions about when to access or reference the resource.
Client applications can also use this description for display purposes in user interfaces or to help users understand the available resources.

member.name: P:ModelContextProtocol.Protocol.Types.Resource.MimeType
member.summary: Gets or sets the MIME type of this resource.

remarks.para: specifies the format of the resource content, helping clients to properly interpret and display the data. Common MIME types include "text/plain" for plain text, "application/pdf" for PDF documents, "image/png" for PNG images, and "application/json" for JSON data.
This property may be if the MIME type is unknown or not applicable for the resource.

member.name: P:ModelContextProtocol.Protocol.Types.Resource.Size
member.summary: Gets or sets the size of the raw resource content (before base64 encoding), in bytes, if known.
member.remarks: This can be used by applications to display file sizes and estimate context window usage.

member.name: P:ModelContextProtocol.Protocol.Types.Resource.Annotations
member.summary: Gets or sets optional annotations for the resource.
member.remarks: These annotations can be used to specify the intended audience (, , or both) and the priority level of the resource. Clients can use this information to filter or prioritize resources for different roles.

member.name: T:ModelContextProtocol.Protocol.Types.ResourceContents
member.summary: Provides a base class representing contents of a resource in the Model Context Protocol.

remarks.para: serves as the base class for different types of resources that can be exchanged through the Model Context Protocol. Resources are identified by URIs and can contain different types of data.

This class is abstract and has two concrete implementations:
- For text-based resources
- For binary data resources
See the schema for more details.

member.remarks: See the schema for details.

member.name: P:ModelContextProtocol.Protocol.Types.ResourcesCapability.Subscribe
member.summary: Gets or sets whether this server supports subscribing to resource updates.

member.name: P:ModelContextProtocol.Protocol.Types.ResourcesCapability.ListChanged
member.summary: Gets or sets whether this server supports notifications for changes to the resource list.
member.remarks: When set to , the server will send notifications using when resources are added, removed, or modified. Clients can register handlers for these notifications to refresh their resource cache.

member.name: P:ModelContextProtocol.Protocol.Types.ResourcesCapability.ListResourceTemplatesHandler
member.summary: Gets or sets the handler for requests.
member.remarks: This handler is called when clients request available resource templates that can be used to create resources within the Model Context Protocol server. Resource templates define the structure and URI patterns for resources accessible in the system, allowing clients to discover available resource types and their access patterns.

member.name: P:ModelContextProtocol.Protocol.Types.ResourcesCapability.ListResourcesHandler
member.summary: Gets or sets the handler for requests.
member.remarks: This handler responds to client requests for available resources and returns information about resources accessible through the server. The implementation should return a with the matching resources.

member.name: P:ModelContextProtocol.Protocol.Types.ResourcesCapability.ReadResourceHandler
member.summary: Gets or sets the handler for requests.
member.remarks: This handler is responsible for retrieving the content of a specific resource identified by its URI in the Model Context Protocol. When a client sends a resources/read request, this handler is invoked with the resource URI. The handler should implement logic to locate and retrieve the requested resource, then return its contents in a ReadResourceResult object.

member.name: P:ModelContextProtocol.Protocol.Types.ResourcesCapability.SubscribeToResourcesHandler
member.summary: Gets or sets the handler for requests.
member.remarks: When a client sends a request, this handler is invoked with the resource URI to be subscribed to. The implementation should register the client's interest in receiving updates for the specified resource. Subscriptions allow clients to receive real-time notifications when resources change, without requiring polling.

member.name: P:ModelContextProtocol.Protocol.Types.ResourcesCapability.UnsubscribeFromResourcesHandler
member.summary: Gets or sets the handler for requests.
member.remarks: When a client sends a request, this handler is invoked with the resource URI to be unsubscribed from. The implementation should remove the client's registration for receiving updates about the specified resource.

member.name: P:ModelContextProtocol.Protocol.Types.ResourcesCapability.ResourceCollection
member.summary: Gets or sets a collection of resources served by the server.

remarks.para: Resources specified via augment the , and handlers, if provided. Resources with template expressions in their URI templates are considered resource templates and are listed via ListResourceTemplate, whereas resources without template parameters are considered static resources and are listed with ListResources.

ReadResource requests will first check the for the exact resource being requested. If no match is found, they'll proceed to try to match the resource against each resource template in . If no match is still found, the request will fall back to any handler registered for .

member.name: T:ModelContextProtocol.Protocol.Types.ResourceTemplate
member.summary: Represents a known resource template that the server is capable of reading.
member.remarks: Resource templates provide metadata about resources available on the server, including how to construct URIs for those resources.

member.name: P:ModelContextProtocol.Protocol.Types.ResourceTemplate.UriTemplate
member.summary: Gets or sets the URI template (according to RFC 6570) that can be used to construct resource URIs.

member.name: P:ModelContextProtocol.Protocol.Types.ResourceTemplate.Name
member.summary: Gets or sets a human-readable name for this resource template.

member.name: P:ModelContextProtocol.Protocol.Types.ResourceTemplate.Description
member.summary: Gets or sets a description of what this resource template represents.

remarks.para: This description helps clients understand the purpose and content of resources that can be generated from this template. It can be used by client applications to provide context about available resource types or to display in user interfaces.
For AI models, this description can serve as a hint about when and how to use the resource template, enhancing the model's ability to generate appropriate URIs.

member.name: P:ModelContextProtocol.Protocol.Types.ResourceTemplate.MimeType
member.summary: Gets or sets the MIME type of this resource template, if known.

remarks.para: Specifies the expected format of resources that can be generated from this template. This helps clients understand what type of content to expect when accessing resources created using this template.
Common MIME types include "text/plain" for plain text, "application/pdf" for PDF documents, "image/png" for PNG images, or "application/json" for JSON data.

member.name: P:ModelContextProtocol.Protocol.Types.ResourceTemplate.Annotations
member.summary: Gets or sets optional annotations for the resource template.
member.remarks: These annotations can be used to specify the intended audience (, , or both) and the priority level of the resource template. Clients can use this information to filter or prioritize resource templates for different roles.

member.summary: Gets whether contains any template expressions.

member.summary: Converts the into a .
member.returns: A if is ; otherwise, .

remarks.para: When a client subscribes to resource updates using , the server will send notifications with this payload whenever the subscribed resource is modified. These notifications allow clients to maintain synchronized state without needing to poll the server for changes.
See the schema for details.

member.summary: Gets or sets the URI of the resource that was updated.
member.remarks: The URI can use any protocol; it is up to the server how to interpret it.

member.name: T:ModelContextProtocol.Protocol.Types.Role
